record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, JUNE 12, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, June 12; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with the first half under the control of the Republicans and the second half under the control of the majority; that upon the conclusion of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of the motion to proceed to H.R. 6; that on Tuesday, the Senate stand

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
